Hello - im working with a custom email template where the clients wants to have a background image with some text and CTA on top. I managed to do this by using VML for outlook - however in outlook it then looks like that the background size is editable (see image). When you drag it, nothing actually happens - but the little boxes on the sides appear if you click anywhere on the VML background.

Has anyone experienced this before, and know how to get red of it? my code is below.

        `<!--[if gte mso 9]>`
        `<v:rect xmlns:v="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:vml" fill="true" fillcolor="none" stroke="false" style="width: {{ maxWidth }}; height: 645px;">`
            `<v:fill type="frame" src="{{ widget.background_image.src }}" color="none" />`
                `<v:textbox style="mso-fit-shape-to-text:false" inset="0,0,0,0">`
        `<![endif]-->`
I'm pretty sure this is common with VML when you click on it. Do they show if you don't click on the background?
